items.name: webserver_certificate_file
items.displayName: SSL/TLS Certificate for Catalog Server Webserver
items.description: Local path to the certificate presented by the Catalog Server debug webserver. This file must be in .pem format. If empty, webserver SSL/TLS support is not enabled.

items.name: catalogd_hdfs_site_conf_safety_valve
items.displayName: Catalog Server HDFS Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hdfs-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: load_catalog_in_background
items.description: If true, loads catalog metadata in the background. If false, metadata is loaded lazily (on access).  Only effective in CDH 5 and Impala 1.2.4 and higher.

items.name: catalogserver_startup_tolerance
items.description: The amount of time allowed after this role is started that failures of health checks that rely on communication with this role will be tolerated.

items.name: core_dump_dir
items.description: Directory where Catalog Server core dump will be placed.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for Impala Catalog Server logs

items.name: webserver_htpassword_user
items.description: Username for Catalog Server web server authentication.
items.validationMessage: Validated Impala webserver username and password parameters.

items.name: catalogd_cmd_args_safety_valve
items.displayName: Catalog Server Command Line Argument Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be added (verbatim) to Catalog Server command line flags. Key names should begin with a hyphen(-). For example: -log_filename=foo.log

items.name: process_resident_set_size_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the resident size of the process.

items.name: catalogd_enable_webserver
items.description: Enable/Disable Catalog Server web server. This web server contains useful information about Catalog Server daemon.

items.name: hive_metastore_timeout
items.displayName: Catalog Server Hive Metastore Connection Timeout
items.description: Timeout for requests to the Hive Metastore Server from Catalog Server. Consider increasing this if you have tables with a lot of metadata and see timeout errors.

items.name: catalogserver_connectivity_tolerance
items.displayName: Catalog Server Connectivity Tolerance at Startup
items.description: The amount of time to wait for the Catalog Server to fully start up and connect to the StateStore before enforcing the connectivity check.

items.name: catalogserver_host_health_enabled
items.displayName: Impala Catalog Server Host Health Test
items.description: When computing the overall Impala Catalog Server health, consider the host's health.

items.name: catalogserver_web_metric_collection_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the duration of the metrics request to the web server.

items.name: webserver_htpassword_password
items.displayName: Catalog Server Web Server User Password
items.description: Password for Catalog Server web server authentication.

items.name: max_log_files
items.description: The number of log files that are kept for each severity level before all older log files are removed. The number has to be greater than 1 to keep at least the current log file open. If set to 0, all log files are retained and log rotation is effectively disabled.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: catalogserver_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: logbuflevel
items.description: Buffer log messages logged at this level or lower (-1 means don't buffer; 0 means buffer INFO only; 1 means buffer WARNING only, ...)

items.name: catalogd_hive_conf_safety_valve
items.displayName: Catalog Server Hive Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hive-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: CATALOGSERVER_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Catalog Server Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: catalog_service_port
items.description: Port where Catalog Server is exported.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: log_dir
items.description: Directory where Catalog Server will place its log files.

items.name: catalogserver_web_metric_collection_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Cloudera Manager Agent can successfully contact and gather metrics from the web server.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: max_log_size
items.displayName: Impala Catalog Server Max Log Size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for Impala Catalog Server logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: catalogserver_scm_health_enabled
items.displayName: Impala Catalog Server Process Health Test
items.description: Enables the health test that the Impala Catalog Server's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: catalogd_hbase_conf_safety_valve
items.displayName: Catalog Server HBase Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hbase-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: catalogserver_webserver_port
items.description: Port where Catalog Server debug web server runs.

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log_verbose_level
items.description: Verbose logging level for the GLog logger. These messages are always logged at 'INFO' log level, so this setting has no effect if Logging Threshold is set to 'WARN' or above.

items.name: catalogserver_connectivity_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that verifies the Catalog Server is connected to the StateStore

items.name: impalad_memory_limit
items.description: Memory limit in bytes for Impala Daemon, enforced by the daemon itself. If reached, queries running on the Impala Daemon may be killed. Leave it blank to let Impala pick its own limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit.

items.name: scratch_dirs
items.description: Directories where Impala Daemon will write data such as spilling information to disk to free up memory. This can potentially be large amounts of data.

items.name: impalad_connectivity_tolerance
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Connectivity Tolerance at Startup
items.description: The amount of time to wait for the Impala Daemon to fully start up and connect to the StateStore before enforcing the connectivity check.

items.name: hs2_port
items.description: Port on which HiveServer2 client requests are served by Impala Daemons.

items.name: impalad_ready_status_check_enabled
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Ready Status Health Check
items.description: Enables the health check that determines if the Impala daemon is ready to process queries.

items.name: executing_queries_timeout_seconds
items.description: The timeout used by the Cloudera Manager Agent's query monitor when communicating with the Impala Daemon web server, specified in seconds.

items.name: audit_event_log_dir
items.description: The directory in which Impala daemon audit event log files are written. If "Impala Audit Event Generation" property is enabled, Impala will generate its audit logs in this directory.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for Impala Daemon logs

items.name: enable_audit_event_log
items.description: Enables audit event generation by Impala daemons. The audit log file will be placed in the directory specified by 'Impala Daemon Audit Log Directory' parameter.

items.name: process_resident_set_size_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the resident size of the process.

items.name: state_store_subscriber_port
items.description: Port where StateStoreSubscriberService is running.

items.name: llama_callback_port
items.description: Port where Llama notification callback should be started

items.name: max_log_files
items.description: The number of log files that are kept for each severity level before all older log files are removed. The number has to be greater than 1 to keep at least the current log file open. If set to 0, all log files are retained and log rotation is effectively disabled.

items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hdfs-site.xml for this role only.

When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: default_query_options
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Query Options Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: A list of key-value pairs of additional query options to pass to the Impala Daemon command line, separated by ','.

items.name: enable_lineage_log
items.description: Enables lineage generation by Impala daemons. The lineage log file is placed in the directory specified by the 'Impala Daemon Lineage Log Directory' parameter.

items.name: max_audit_event_log_file_size
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Maximum Audit Log File Size
items.description: The maximum size (in queries) of the Impala Daemon audit event log file before a new one is created.

items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: IMPALAD_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for Impala Daemon logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: impalad_result_cache_max_size
items.description: Maximum number of query results a client may request to be cached on a per-query basis to support restarting fetches. This option guards against unreasonably large result caches requested by clients. Requests exceeding this maximum will be rejected.

items.name: llama_max_request_attempts
items.description: Maximum number of times a request to reserve, expand, or release resources is attempted until the request is cancelled.

items.name: local_library_dir
items.description: User-defined function (UDF) libraries are copied from HDFS into this local directory.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: webserver_certificate_file
items.displayName: SSL/TLS Certificate for Impala Daemon Webserver
items.description: Local path to the certificate presented by the Impala daemon debug webserver. This file must be in .pem format. If empty, webserver SSL/TLS support is not enabled.

items.name: lineage_event_log_dir
items.description: The directory in which Impala daemon lineage log files are written. If "Impala Lineage Generation" property is enabled, Impala generates its lineage logs in this directory.

items.name: impalad_hbase_conf_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Daemon HBase Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hbase-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: core_dump_dir
items.description: Directory where Impala Daemon core dump will be placed.

items.name: impalad_load_balancer
items.description: Address of the load balancer used for Impala daemons. Should be specified in host:port format. If this is specified and Kerberos is enabled, Cloudera Manager adds a principal for 'impala/&ltload_balancer_host&gt@&ltrealm&gt' to the keytab for all Impala daemons.

items.name: impalad_web_metric_collection_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the duration of the metrics request to the web server.

items.name: webserver_htpassword_user
items.description: Username for Impala Daemon webserver authentication.
items.validationMessage: Validated Impala webserver username and password parameters.

items.name: query_monitoring_period_seconds
items.description: The polling period of the Impala query monitor in the Cloudera Manager Agent, specified in seconds. If set to zero, query monitoring is disabled.

items.name: impalad_webserver_port
items.description: Port where Impala debug web server runs.

items.name: hive_metastore_timeout
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Hive Metastore Connection Timeout
items.description: Timeout for requests to the Hive Metastore Server from Impala. Consider increasing this if you have tables with a lot of metadata and see timeout errors.

items.name: llama_registration_timeout_secs
items.description: Maximum number of seconds that Impala attempts to register or re-register with Llama. If registration is unsuccessful, Impala cancels the action with an error, which could result in an impalad startup failure or a cancelled query. A setting of -1 seconds means try indefinitely.

items.name: webserver_htpassword_password
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Web Server User Password
items.description: Password for Impala Daemon webserver authentication.

items.name: impala_hive_conf_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Hive Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hive-site.xml for this role only.

items.displayName: Impala Daemon Scratch Directories Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's Directories where Impala Daemon will write data such as spilling information to disk to free up memory. This can potentially be large amounts of data.. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Directories where Impala Daemon will write data such as spilling information to disk to free up memory. This can potentially be large amounts of data. Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: impalad_fair_scheduler_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Fair Scheduler Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: An XML string to use verbatim for the contents of fair-scheduler.xml for Impala Daemons. This configuration only has effect on Impala versions 1.3 or greater.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: impalad_connectivity_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that verifies the Impala Daemon is connected to the StateStore.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: impalad_scratch_directories_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Scratch Directories Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's Directories where Impala Daemon will write data such as spilling information to disk to free up memory. This can potentially be large amounts of data..

items.name: disk_spill_encryption
items.description: Encrypt and verify the integrity of all data spilled to disk as part of a query. This feature is only supported for Impala 2.0 and higher and CDH 5.2 and higher (which includes Impala 2.0).

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: log_dir
items.description: Directory where Impala Daemon will place its log files.

items.name: llama_registration_wait_secs
items.description: Number of seconds to wait between attempts during Llama registration.

items.name: impalad_ldap_ca_certificate
items.description: The location on disk of the certificate, in .pem format, used to confirm the authenticity of the LDAP server certificate. This is the Certificate Authority (CA) certificate, and it was used to sign the LDAP server certificate. If not set, Impala by default trusts all certificates supplied by the LDAP server, which means that an attacker could potentially intercept otherwise encrypted usernames and passwords.

items.name: max_lineage_log_file_size
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Maximum Lineage Log File Size
items.description: The maximum size (in entries) of the Impala daemon lineage log file before a new one is created.

items.name: be_port
items.description: Port on which ImpalaBackendService is exported.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: beeswax_port
items.description: Port on which Beeswax client requests are served by Impala Daemons.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: impalad_ready_status_check_startup_tolerance
items.displayName: Impala Daemon Ready Status Startup Tolerance
items.description: The amount of time at Impala Daemon startup allowed for the Impala Daemon to start accepting new queries for processing.

items.name: impalad_web_metric_collection_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Cloudera Manager Agent can successfully contact and gather metrics from the web server.

items.name: llama_am_server_thrift_server_min_threads
items.description: Minimum number of threads used by the Llama ApplicationMaster auxiliary service uses for serving client requests.

items.name: llama_http_port
items.description: Port on which the Llama ApplicationMaster listens to HTTP requests.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for Impala Llama ApplicationMaster logs

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: llama_am_cache_eviction_timeout_policy_idle_timeout_ms
items.description: Timeout policy for resources being cached.

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: llama_am_server_thrift_client_notifier_max_retries
items.description: Maximum number of retries for a client notification. After the maximum number of client notification retries has been reached without success the client is considered lost and all its reservations are released. A successful client notification resets the retries count.

items.name: llama_am_server_thrift_client_acl
items.description: ACL for Impala ApplicationMaster clients.  The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".  A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.  These take effect only if security is enabled.

items.name: llama_fair_scheduler_safety_valve
items.displayName: Fair Scheduler XML Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Enter an XML string that will be inserted verbatim into the Fair Scheduler allocations file. Overrides the configuration set using the Pools configuration UI.  This configuration only has effect on Impala versions 1.3 or greater.

items.name: llama_am_server_thrift_server_max_threads
items.description: Maximum number of threads used by the Llama ApplicationMaster auxiliary service uses for serving client requests.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: llama_scm_health_enabled
items.displayName: Impala Llama ApplicationMaster Process Health Test
items.description: Enables the health test that the Impala Llama ApplicationMaster's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: llama_am_gang_anti_deadlock_no_allocation_limit_ms
items.description: Interval of time without any new allocation that will trigger the Impala ApplicationMaster anti-deadlock logic.

items.name: llama_am_resource_normalizing_enabled
items.description: Whether to break resource requests into smaller requests of standard size before the resource cache. The sizes are taken from Yarn settings Container Memory Increment and Container Virtual CPU Cores Increment.

items.name: llama_am_server_thrift_transport_timeout_ms
items.description: Socket time, in milliseconds, used Llama ApplicationMaster auxiliary service for all its server and client Thrift connections.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Llama ApplicationMaster Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: max_log_size
items.displayName: Impala Llama ApplicationMaster Max Log Size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for Impala Llama ApplicationMaster logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: llama_am_gang_anti_deadlock_backoff_percent
items.description: Percentage of resources that will be backed off by the Impala ApplicationMaster anti-deadlock logic. Random reservations will be backed off until the percentage of backed off resources reaches this percentage.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: llama_am_server_thrift_client_notifier_retry_interval_ms
items.description: Client notification retry interval, in milliseconds.

items.name: stacks_collection_frequency
items.description: The frequency with which stacks are collected.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: llama_am_server_thrift_admin_address
items.description: Port on which the Llama ApplicationMaster listens to administrative requests on its administrative Thrift interface.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_enabled
items.displayName: Dump Heap When Out of Memory
items.description: When set, generates heap dump file when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: max_log_backup_index
items.displayName: Impala Llama ApplicationMaster Maximum Log File Backups
items.description: The maximum number of rolled log files to keep for Impala Llama ApplicationMaster logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: process_groupname
items.description: The group that the Llama processes should run as.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: kerberos_role_princ_name
items.description: Kerberos principal used by the Impala Llama ApplicationMaster roles.

items.name: llama_am_cache_enabled
items.description: Whether Llama should cache allocated resources on release.

items.name: llama_host_health_enabled
items.displayName: Impala Llama ApplicationMaster Host Health Test
items.description: When computing the overall Impala Llama ApplicationMaster health, consider the host's health.

items.name: llama_am_core_queues
items.description: Queues Llama ApplicationMaster should connect to at start up.

items.name: llama_am_queue_expire_ms
items.description: Time in milliseconds after which Llama will discard its AM for a queue that has been empty of reservations. Does not apply to queues specified with the Core Queues property.

items.name: oom_sigkill_enabled
items.description: When set, a SIGKILL signal is sent to the role process when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: llama_port
items.description: Port on which the Llama ApplicationMaster serves its Thrift interface.

items.name: llama_config_valve
items.displayName: Impala Llama ApplicationMaster Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for llama-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into llama-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: llama_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: llama_bind_wildcard
items.displayName: Bind Impala Llama ApplicationMaster to Wildcard Address
items.description: If enabled, the Impala Llama ApplicationMaster binds to the wildcard address ("0.0.0.0") on all of its ports.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: llama_am_server_thrift_client_notifier_heartbeat_ms
items.description: Llama ApplicationMaster heartbeat interval, in milliseconds. On each heartbeat the ApplicationMaster submits new reservations to YARN ResourceManager and gets updates from it.

items.name: llama_am_gang_anti_deadlock_max_delay_ms
items.description: Maximum amount of time the backed off reservations will be in 'backed off' state. The actual amount time is a random value between the minimum and the maximum.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: LLAMA_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Llama ApplicationMaster Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: llama_java_opts
items.displayName: Java Configuration Options for Llama Server
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: process_username
items.description: The user that the Llama process should run as.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: llama_am_gang_anti_deadlock_min_delay_ms
items.description: Minimum amount of time the backed off reservations will be in 'backed off' state. The actual amount time is a random value between the minimum and the maximum.

items.name: llama_log_dir
items.description: Directory where Llama will place its log files.

items.name: llama_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of Impala Llama ApplicationMaster in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: llama_am_server_thrift_admin_acl
items.description: ACL for Impala ApplicationMaster admins. The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".  A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.  These take effect only if security is enabled.

items.name: statestore_webserver_port
items.description: Port where StateStore debug web server runs.

items.name: webserver_certificate_file
items.description: Local path to the certificate presented by the StateStore debug webserver. This file must be in .pem format. If empty, webserver SSL/TLS support is not enabled.

items.name: statestore_scm_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Impala StateStore's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: core_dump_dir
items.description: Directory where StateStore core dump will be placed.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for Impala StateStore logs

items.name: webserver_htpassword_user
items.description: Username for Statestore webserver authentication.
items.validationMessage: Validated Impala webserver username and password parameters.

items.name: statestore_host_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall Impala StateStore health, consider the host's health.

items.name: process_resident_set_size_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the resident size of the process.

items.name: statestore_startup_tolerance
items.description: The amount of time allowed after this role is started that failures of health checks that rely on communication with this role will be tolerated.

items.name: statestore_cmd_args_safety_valve
items.displayName: Statestore Command Line Argument Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be added (verbatim) to StateStore command line flags.

items.name: statestore_web_metric_collection_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the duration of the metrics request to the web server.

items.name: webserver_htpassword_password
items.description: Password for Statestore webserver authentication.

items.name: max_log_files
items.description: The number of log files that are kept for each severity level before all older log files are removed. The number has to be greater than 1 to keep at least the current log file open. If set to 0, all log files are retained and log rotation is effectively disabled.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: STATESTORE_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala StateStore Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: state_store_num_server_worker_threads
items.description: Number of worker threads for the thread manager underlying the StateStore Thrift server.

items.name: statestore_enable_webserver
items.description: Enable/Disable StateStore web server. This web server contains useful information about StateStore daemon.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: logbuflevel
items.description: Buffer log messages logged at this level or lower (-1 means don't buffer; 0 means buffer INFO only; 1 means buffer WARNING only, ...)

items.name: statestore_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: log_dir
items.description: Directory where StateStore will place its log files.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: statestore_web_metric_collection_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Cloudera Manager Agent can successfully contact and gather metrics from the web server.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: max_log_size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for Impala StateStore logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: state_store_pending_task_count_max
items.description: Maximum number of tasks allowed to be pending at the thread manager underlying the StateStore Thrift server (0 allows infinitely many pending tasks)

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log_verbose_level
items.description: Verbose logging level for the GLog logger. These messages are always logged at 'INFO' log level, so this setting has no effect if Logging Threshold is set to 'WARN' or above.

items.name: state_store_port
items.description: Port where StateStoreService is exported.

items.name: hdfs_service
items.description: Name of the HDFS service that this Impala service instance depends on

items.name: hive_service
items.description: Name of the Hive service that this Impala service instance depends on

items.name: impala_impalads_healthy_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the overall Impala Daemon health. The check returns "Concerning" health if the percentage of "Healthy" Impala Daemons falls below the warning threshold. The check is unhealthy if the total percentage of "Healthy" and "Concerning" Impala Daemons falls below the critical threshold.

items.name: impala_catalogserver_health_enabled
items.displayName: Impala Catalog Server Role Health Test
items.description: When computing the overall IMPALA health, consider Impala Catalog Server's health

items.name: ldap_domain
items.description: When set, this value is appended to all usernames before authenticating with the LDAP server. For example, if this parameter is set to "my.domain.com", and the user authenticating to the Impala daemon is "mike", then "mike@my.domain.com" is passed to the LDAP server. If this field is unset, the username remains unaltered before being passed to the LDAP server. This parameter is mutually exclusive with LDAP BaseDN and LDAP Pattern.

items.name: admission_control_queue_timeout
items.description: Maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) that a request waits to be admitted before timing out. Must be a positive integer.

items.name: dfs_client_read_shortcircuit
items.description: Enable HDFS short circuit read. This allows a client co-located with the DataNode to read HDFS file blocks directly. This gives a performance boost to distributed clients that are aware of locality.

items.name: smon_derived_configs_safety_valve
items.displayName: Service Monitor Derived Configs Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a list of derived configuration properties that will be used by the Service Monitor instead of the default ones.

items.name: ssl_private_key
items.description: Local path to the private key that matches the certificate specified in the Certificate for Clients. This file must be in PEM format, and is required if the SSL/TLS Certificate for Clients is supplied.

items.name: navigator_event_tracker
items.description:
Configures the rules for event tracking and coalescing. This feature is used to define equivalency between different audit events. When events match, according to a set of configurable parameters, only one entry in the audit list is generated for all the matching events.

Tracking works by keeping a reference to events when they first appear, and comparing other incoming events against the "tracked" events according to the rules defined here.

Event trackers are defined in a JSON object like the following:

{
  "timeToLive" : [integer],
  "fields" : [
    {
      "type" : [string],
      "name" : [string]
    }
  ]
}

Where:

  • timeToLive: maximum amount of time an event will be tracked, in milliseconds. Must be provided. This defines how long, since it's first seen, an event will be tracked. A value of 0 disables tracking.
  • fields: list of fields to compare when matching events against tracked events.

Each field has an evaluator type associated with it. The evaluator defines how the field data is to be compared. The following evaluators are available:

  • value: uses the field value for comparison.
  • userName: treats the field value as a userName, and ignores any host-specific data. This is useful for environment using Kerberos, so that only the principal name and realm are compared.

The following is the list of fields that can be used to compare Impala events:

  • operation: the Sentry operation being performed.
  • username: the user performing the action.
  • ipAddress: the IP from where the request originated.
  • allowed: whether the operation was allowed or denied.
  • databaseName: the database affected by the operation.
  • tableName: the table affected by the operation.
  • objectType: the type of object affected by the operation.
  • privilege: the privilege associated with the operation.

items.name: admission_control_single_pool_max_queued
items.description: Configures the maximum number of queued queries for admission control when using a single pool. -1 or 0 disables queuing, i.e. incoming requests are rejected if they can not be executed immediately. Ignored when Dynamic Resource Pools for Admission Control is enabled.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this service reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: enable_core_dump
items.description: Used to generate a core dump to get more information about an Impala crash. Unless otherwise configured systemwide using /proc/sys/kernel/core_pattern, the dump is generated in the 'current directory' of the Impala process (usually a subdirectory of the /var/run/cloudera-scm-agent/process directory). The core file can be very large.

items.name: kerberos_reinit_interval
items.description: Number of minutes between reestablishing our ticket with the Kerberos server.

items.name: navigator_audit_enabled
items.description: Enable collection of audit events from the service's roles.

items.name: impalad_sentry_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Service Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for sentry-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into sentry-site.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: service_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this service. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific service.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the followig JSON formatted trigger fires if there are more than 10 DataNodes with more than 500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleType = DataNode and last(fd_open) > 500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 10, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: impala_query_aggregates
items.description: Controls the aggregate metrics generated for Impala queries. The structure is a JSON list of the attributes to aggregate and the entities to aggregate to. For example, if the attributeName is 'hdfs_bytes_read' and the aggregationTargets is ['USER'] then the Service Monitor will create the metric 'impala_query_hdfs_bytes_read_rate' and, every ten minutes, will record the total hdfs bytes read for each user across all their Impala queries. By default it will also record the number of queries issues ('num_impala_queries_rate') for both users and pool. For a full list of the supported attributes see the Impala search page. Note that the valid aggregation targets are USER, YARN_POOL, and IMPALA (the service), and that these aggregate metrics can be viewed on both the reports and charts search pages.

items.name: impala_ldap_uri
items.description: The URI of the LDAP server to use if LDAP is enabled. The URI must be prefixed with ldap:// or ldaps://. The URI can optionally specify the port, for example: ldap://ldap_server.example.com:389. ldaps:// is only supported in Impala 1.4 or CDH 5.1 or higher, and usually requires that you specify a port.

items.name: kerberos_princ_name
items.description: Kerberos principal short name used by all roles of this service.

items.name: navigator_audit_event_filter
items.description:
Event filters are defined in a JSON object like the following: 

{
  "defaultAction" : ("accept", "discard"),
  "rules" : [
    {
      "action" : ("accept", "discard"),
      "fields" : [
        {
          "name" : "fieldName",
          "match" : "regex"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

A filter has a default action and a list of rules, in order of precedence. Each rule defines an action, and a list of fields to match against the audit event.

A rule is "accepted" if all the listed field entries match the audit event. At that point, the action declared by the rule is taken.

If no rules match the event, the default action is taken. Actions default to "accept" if not defined in the JSON object.

The following is the list of fields that can be filtered for Impala events:

  • userName: the user performing the action.
  • ipAddress: the IP from where the request originated.
  • operation: the Impala operation being performed.
  • databaseName: the databaseName for the operation.
  • tableName: the tableName for the operation.

items.name: admission_control_single_pool_max_requests
items.description: Configures the maximum number of concurrently running queries for admission control when using a single pool. -1 indicates no limit and 0 indicates all incoming requests will be rejected. Ignored when Dynamic Resource Pools for Admission Control is enabled.

items.name: impala_service_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Service Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: impala_cmd_args_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Command Line Argument Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be added (verbatim) to Impala Daemon command-line flags. Applies to all roles in this service. Key names should begin with a hyphen(-). For example: -log_filename=foo.log

items.name: admission_control_enabled
items.description: Use Dynamic Resource Pools to configure Impala admission control or RM for this Impala service. These features are only supported in Impala 1.3 or higher deployments.

items.name: admission_control_single_pool_mem_limit
items.description: Configures the max memory of running queries for admission control when using a single pool. -1 or 0 indicates no limit. Ignored when Dynamic Resource Pools for Admission Control is enabled.

items.name: impala_assignment_locality_minimum
items.description: The minimum number of assignments that must occur during the test time period before the threshold values will be checked. Until this number of assignments have been observed in the test time period the health test will be disabled.

items.name: client_services_ssl_enabled
items.displayName: Enable TLS/SSL for Impala Client Services
items.description: Encrypt communication between clients (like ODBC, JDBC, and the Impala shell) and the Impala daemon using Transport Layer Security (TLS) (formerly known as Secure Socket Layer (SSL)).

items.name: navigator_lineage_enabled
items.description: Enable collection of lineage from the service's roles.

items.name: process_groupname
items.description: The group that this Impala's processes should run as (except Llama, which has its own group).

items.name: navigator_client_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Client Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for navigator.client.properties
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into the client configuration for navigator.client.properties.

items.name: impala_schedule_rules
items.description: A list specifying the rules to run to determine which Fair Scheduler configuration to use. Typically edited using the Rules configuration UI. This configuration only has effect on Impala versions 1.3 or greater.

items.name: ldap_bind_pattern
items.description: When set, this parameter allows arbitrary mapping from usernames into a Distinguished Name (DN). The string specified must have a placeholder named "#UID" inside it, and that #UID is replaced with the username. For example, you could mimic the behavior of LDAP BaseDN by specifying "uid=#UID,ou=People,dc=cloudera,dc=com". When the username of "mike" comes in, it replaces the #UID and the result is "uid=mike,ou=People,dc=cloudera,dc=com". This option should be used when more control over the DN is needed. This parameter is mutually exclusive with LDAP Domain and LDAP BaseDN.

items.name: statestore_subscriber_timeout
items.description: Time in seconds before Impala Daemon or Catalog Server times out with the StateStore.

items.name: hbase_client_retries_number
items.description: Maximum number of HBase client retries for Impala. Used as a maximum for all operations such as fetching of the root region from the root RegionServer, getting a cell's value, and starting a row update. Overrides configuration in the HBase service.

items.name: navigator_audit_queue_policy
items.description: Action to take when the audit event queue is full. Drop the event or shutdown the affected process.

items.name: use_debug_build
items.description: Use debug build of Impala binaries when starting roles. Useful when performing diagnostic activities to get more information in the stacktrace or core dump.

items.name: hbase_service
items.description: Name of the HBase service that this Impala service instance depends on

items.name: enable_ldap_auth
items.description: When checked, LDAP-based authentication for users is enabled. Usernames and passwords are transmitted in the clear unless encryption is turned on. To encrypt the network traffic from the Impala daemon to the LDAP server, use either an ldaps:// URI or select 'Enable LDAP TLS'.  To encrypt network traffic from clients to the Impala daemon, specify 'Enable TLS/SSL for Impala Client Services'.

items.name: sentry_enabled
items.displayName: Enable Sentry Authorization using Policy Files
items.description: Use Sentry to enable role-based, fine-grained authorization. This configuration enables Sentry using policy files. To enable Sentry using Sentry service instead, add Sentry service as a dependency to Impala service. Sentry service provides concurrent and secure access to authorization policy metadata and is the recommended option for enabling Sentry. Sentry is supported only on Impala 1.1 or later deployments.

items.name: impala_statestore_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall IMPALA health, consider Impala StateStore's health

items.name: impala_llamas_healthy_thresholds
items.displayName: Healthy Impala Llama ApplicationMaster Monitoring Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the overall Impala Llama ApplicationMaster health. The check returns "Concerning" health if the percentage of "Healthy" Impala Llama ApplicationMasters falls below the warning threshold. The check is unhealthy if the total percentage of "Healthy" and "Concerning" Impala Llama ApplicationMasters falls below the critical threshold.

items.name: impala_assignment_locality_window
items.description: The time period over which to compute the assignment locality ratio. Specified in minutes.

items.name: impala_assignment_locality_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for the assignment locality health test. Specified as a percentage of total assignments.

items.name: navigator_lineage_client_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: Impala Client Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for navigator.lineage.client.properties
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into the client configuration for navigator.lineage.client.properties.

items.name: user_query_list_settings
items.displayName: Non-Admin Users Query List Visibility Settings
items.description: Controls which queries a non-admin user can see in the queries list view

items.name: enable_ldap_tls
items.description: If true, attempts to establish a TLS (Transport Layer Security) connection with the LDAP server. Only supported in Impala 1.4 or CDH 5.1 or higher. Not required when using an LDAP URI with prefix ldaps://, because that already specifies TLS.

items.name: impala_authorized_proxy_user_config
items.description: Specifies the set of authorized proxy users (users who can impersonate other users during authorization) and whom they are allowed to impersonate. Input is a semicolon-separated list of key=value pairs of authorized proxy users to the user(s) they can impersonate. These users are specified as a comma separated list of short usernames, or '*' to indicate all users. For example: joe=alice,bob;hue=*;admin=*. Only valid when Sentry is enabled.

items.name: zookeeper_service
items.description: Name of the ZooKeeper service to use for leader election and fencing when Llama is configured for High Availability. This service dependency is required when more than one Llama role is present.

items.name: ldap_baseDN
items.description: When set, this parameter is used to convert the username into the LDAP Distinguished Name (DN), so that the resulting DN looks like uid=username,X. For example, if this parameter is set to "ou=People,dc=cloudera,dc=com", and the username passed in is "mike", the resulting authentication passed to the LDAP server looks like "uid=mike,ou=People,dc=cloudera,dc=com". This parameter is frequently useful when authenticating against an OpenLDAP server. This parameter is mutually exclusive with LDAP Domain and LDAP Pattern.

items.name: admin_query_list_settings
items.displayName: Admin Users Query List Visibility Settings
items.description: Controls which queries admin users can see in the queries list view

items.name: hbase_rpc_timeout
items.description: Timeout in milliseconds for all HBase RPCs made by Impala. Overrides configuration in HBase service.

items.name: ssl_server_certificate
items.description: Local path to the X509 certificate that will identify the Impala daemon to clients during SSL/TLS connections. This file must be in PEM format.

items.name: all_admission_control_enabled
items.description: Use Impala Admission Control to throttle Impala requests. Unless 'Enable Dynamic Resource Pools' is enabled, Impala uses a single, default pool that is configured using the Single Pool configurations below. These features are only supported in Impala 1.3 or higher deployments.

items.name: process_username
items.description: The user that this Impala's processes should run as (except Llama, which has its own user).

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: sentry_service
items.description: Name of the Sentry service that this Impala service instance depends on. If selected, Impala uses this Sentry service to look up authorization privileges. Before enabling Sentry, read the requirements and configuration steps in Setting Up The Sentry Service.

items.name: yarn_service
items.description: Name of YARN service to use for resource management integration between Impala and YARN. This service dependency and the existence of a Llama role is required for using said integration.
items.validationMessage: Both Llama role and YARN dependency are correctly configured.

items.name: impala_scheduled_allocations
items.description: JSON representation of all the configurations that the Fair Scheduler can take on across all schedules. Typically edited using the Pools configuration UI. This configuration only has effect on Impala versions 1.3 or greater.
